meanings.definition: To express a thought or idea concisely and effectively.
meanings.sent1: She aphorised her feelings in a single sentence.
meanings.sent2: He always aphorised his wisdom in short quotes.
meanings.sent3: The teacher aphorised the lesson for the students to easily remember.
meanings.sent4: The poet aphorised the beauty of nature in his haiku.
meanings.sent5: The author aphorised the moral of the story for the readers to ponder.

meanings.definition: To condense a complex idea into a short, memorable statement.
meanings.sent1: The scientist aphorised the theory for easy understanding.
meanings.sent2: She aphorised the philosophy into a catchy phrase.
meanings.sent3: The comedian aphorised the joke to make the audience laugh.
meanings.sent4: The artist aphorised the concept into a striking image.
meanings.sent5: He aphorised the solution to the problem for quick implementation.
